alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Nash; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Wayne, southern Nash, western Wilson and northeastern Johnston Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bailey, or 18 miles northeast of Smithfield, moving east at 15 mph. This includes Interstate 95 between Nashville and Selma. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilson, Elm City, Fremont, Bailey, Micro, Selma, Sharpsburg, Kenly, Lucama and Middlesex. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Slow down and use caution to avoid hydroplaning.
